content: section on your last repeat continue working on the right side head repeat row 1-90 this time also working a 1x1 rib for the last 3 row to prevent curling arm 2 leg 1 leg 2 repeat row 1-90 for the next 3 sections replace bor marker if it was removed front round 1 bind off 144 sts pm k48 pm k48 round 2 backwards-loop co 46 sts pm co 46 sts pm co 46 sts and rejoin the new sts in the round *sm ssk k to 2 before next marker k2tog* repeat for the second leg you should now have 230 sts row 3 k around making sure to 1x1 rib the section for the head row 4 ssk k to 2 before next marker k 2 decrease* repeat around all 5 sections making sure to 1x1 rib for the section for the head row 5 k around sm as you come across them row 6 ssk k to 2 before next marker k 2 decrease* repeat around all 5 sections row 7-46 repeat row 5 and 6 until 10 sts remain row 47 k2tog to the end of row starfish onesie by @knitsbybethany 3 bind off your work with either a sewn bind off or by sewing the yarn end through your active sts this would be a similar bind off to a hat finishing sew in all ends block the project flat allow to fully dry before placing zippers using a sewing needle and thread sew your 2 zippers in place the top of the zipper should be towards the top of the garment when fully zipped if the baby has especially sensitive skin it may be beneficial to sew a lining or sofer fabric to the inside of the zipper to protect the skin this should not block the function of the zipper instagram @knitsbybethany // ravelry knitsbybethany share your version of the starfish onesie on instagram using the hashtag #starfishonesie happy knitting
